data: Awards & Recognition Celebrate the excellence of care at Lee Health. Explore our achievements and national honors from trusted organizations recognizing our commitment to quality, safety, and patient experience. 2026 Awards & Recognition Lee Health Hospitals Recognized with Magnet Designations from the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) Lee Health is pleased to announce that both Golisano Children’s Hospital and HealthPark Medical Center have received Magnet designations from the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC). This is the highest honor awarded to healthcare organizations for nursing excellence and marks the first time both hospitals have received this recognition. Lee Memorial Hospital and HealthPark Medical Center have ranked in the Castle Connolly Accolades Lee Memorial Hospital and HealthPark Medical Center have ranked in the Castle Connolly Accolades. Castle Connolly Accolades recognize health systems, hospitals, and physician practices who provide an outstanding level of high quality healthcare through their top-ranked Castle Connolly Top Doctor physicians. Accolades are presented based on the number of Top Doctors at a given institution, with consideration given to the institution type, location, and area of specialty. Two Lee Health ICUs Honored with Beacon Award for Excellence Lee Health’s Intensive Care Units (ICUs) at Cape Coral Hospital and Lee Memorial Hospital are proud to be awarded a national honor by the American Association of Critical-Care Nurses (AACN). The Beacon Award for Excellence is a significant milestone acknowledging exceptional patient care and healthy work environments. It recognizes unit caregivers who successfully improve patient outcomes and align practices with AACN’s six Healthy Work Environment Standards. Lee Memorial and HealthPark Honored Among Forbes’ Top Hospitals 2026 Lee Memorial Hospital and HealthPark Medical Center are named to the inaugural Forbes’ Top Hospitals 2026 list. The Lee Health locations are the only hospitals in Southwest Florida to earn this prestigious national recognition. Forbes developed its first-ever Top Hospitals list to help consumers navigate the complex healthcare landscape by identifying general acute care hospitals that consistently deliver high-quality, high-value care. HealthPark Care Center Named One of America's Best Nursing Homes Newsweek and Statista have recognized HealthPark Care Center on their 2026 list of America’s Best Nursing Homes! This ranking highlights the top nursing homes in the 25 states with the highest number of facilities, as identified by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). The evaluation was based on four key data sources: Quality Metrics from CMS A National Online Survey Accreditation Data Google Reviews As a skilled nursing facility, HealthPark Care Center combines the latest rehabilitative treatments with compassionate, patient-centered care to help patients recover from surgery or other medical conditions. Most patients who recover at HealthPark Care Center experience improved quality of life, returning home with better mobility, less pain, greater joint flexibility and faster recovery. Lee Health Hospitals have Earned the 2026 Women’s Choice Award® as a Best Hospital Lee Health hospitals have earned the 2026 Women’s Choice Award® as a Best Hospital* for: Lee Memorial Hospital Patient Safety Obstetrics Heart Care Orthopedics Knee & Hip Replacement Cancer Care Stroke Care Women’s Services Gulf Coast Medical Center Emergency Care Orthopedics Stroke Care Cape Coral Hospital Patient Safety Orthopedics Knee & Hip Replacement About the Women’s Choice Award The award methodology is 100% objective, replicable and uniform and is based on objective, transparent criteria including clinical performance, patient satisfaction, and accreditations.The Women’s Choice Award is the only national recognition that combines clinical quality with what matters most to women—experience and trust (HCAHPS). 2025 Awards & Recognition Lee Health Earns Top Marks for Healthcare Technology Implementation Lee Health is among one of the best healthcare systems in the country when it comes to implementing the latest in patient care technology, according to a recently published national recognition. The College of Healthcare Information Management Executives (CHIME) announced that Lee Health has earned the 2025 CHIME Digital Health Most Wired recognition as a certified acute level 9 and ambulatory level 9 facility. The CHIME Digital Health Most Wired program conducts an annual survey to assess how effectively healthcare organizations apply core and advanced technologies to their clinical and business programs to help improve healthcare in their communities. The purpose of the Most Wired program is to elevate the healthcare of communities around the world through the optimal use of information technology. The annual survey is designed to identify and recognize healthcare organizations that exemplify best practices through their adoption, implementation and use of technology. Lee Health is recognized by the Leapfrog Group for 2025 The Leapfrog Group has released its spring and fall 2025 Hospital Safety Grades for Lee Health's Hospitals. These grades speak to the safe, high-quality care patients can expect to receive in our hospitals. The Safety Grade assigns letter grades of “A,” “B,” “C,” “D,” and “F” to hospitals across the country based on their performance in preventing medical errors, infections, and other harms. Every Lee Health hospital earned a raw score over 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, and the hospitals that earned a “B” grade were within only 6 percent of the 3.202 threshold of earning an “A” grade. We work hard every day to provide nationally-recognized care, compassion, and a safe environment for our patients. We are proud to serve you and your family! HealthPark Medical Center: Awarded an ‘A’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2025 Gulf Coast Medical Center: Awarded an ‘B’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2025 Cape Coral Hospital: Awarded an ‘A’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2025 Lee Memorial Hospital: Awarded an ‘A’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2025 Lee Health Earns Magna Cum Laude Distinction on Epic’s 2025 Honor Roll Lee Health has been awarded the Magna Cum Laude distinction on Epic’s 2025 Honor Roll, joining only 64 health systems nationwide recognized for this honor. This marks the eighth consecutive year Lee Health has earned this recognition from Epic, one of the world’s leading healthcare technology companies. Epic’s Honor Roll highlights health systems that go above and beyond in adopting best practices and the latest innovations to improve: Ease of use for providers and nurses Enterprise data and analytics Patient experience Population health Infrastructure and more This recognition reflects Lee Health’s ongoing commitment to delivering state-of-the-art care while ensuring providers, nurses, and patients have the most advanced tools to support health and well-being across Southwest Florida. All Four Adult Acute Care Hospitals Earned Four Stars in CMS Quality Star Ratings Patient safety and the highest quality of care are Lee Health’s top priorities, and the health system is pleased to announce that all four of its adult acute care hospitals have been named four-star hospitals by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). Four stars is one of the highest accolades in the annual rating system. All four Lee Health adult acute care facilities have ranked among the leading hospitals in the nation with four-star or better for the last three rating periods. Children’s hospitals are not included in this ranking system. Golisano Children’s Hospital Honored with 2025 Hospital Impact Award Golisano Children’s Hospital, part of Lee Health, has been awarded the 2025 Hospital Impact Award by Children’s Miracle Network®. The prestigious recognition was announced during Children’s Hospitals Week, held at the Walt Disney World Dolphin Hotel in Orlando, Florida. Golisano was honored with the first award of the evening which celebrates exceptional commitment to pediatric healthcare and community engagement. The hospital was recognized for its unwavering dedication to improving the lives of children and families across Southwest Florida and for pioneering sensory-friendly care, including introducing the nation’s first sensory-friendly ambulance and becoming only the second hospital in the country to achieve Certified Autism Center™ designation. These milestones highlight Golisano’s leadership in creating inclusive, accessible care environments for children of all needs and abilities. The Lee Health Mobile Unit Recognized at the 2025 Edison Awards™ The Lee Health Mobile Unit was awarded the Bronze Award in the “Emergency & On-Site Health Solutions” category at The Edison Awards™! The Lee Health Mobile Unit is a game-changer, bringing accessible, high-quality care directly into our Southwest Florida communities, especially in times of crisis or when care is needed most. The Lee Health Mobile Unit includes two exam rooms and is staffed by a nurse and an advanced practice provider. The Edison Awards™ is among the most prestigious honors and celebrates excellence in new product and service development, marketing, design and innovation. Established in 1987, The Edison Awards™ has been presented to some of the most innovative products and business leaders in the world, and we are very honored and proud to join the list of winners. Lee Health Coconut Point Emergency Department Honored by PRC The Lee Health Coconut Point Emergency Department was honored with an Award of Distinction for Excellent Performance by PRC. The Award of Distinction for Excellent Performance recognizes inpatient facilities and emergency departments that score at or above the 100th percentile compared to PRC’s national client database for the prior calendar year. HealthPark Medical Center Achieves Primary Stroke Center Certification HealthPark Medical Center is proud to achieve the Primary Stroke Center Certification from DNV Healthcare. This is the facility’s first time receiving this recognition and reflects years of preparation and coordinated clinical efforts. The certification confirms the ability to deliver timely, advanced stroke care aligned with national quality and safety standards. Approximately 26 percent of emergency departments nationwide have earned this level of certification. What this means for the community Faster diagnosis and treatment of stroke symptoms Ability to manage a broader range of stroke-related conditions Dedicated stroke unit for continued specialized care Lee Health Hospitals Named “Straight A” Hospitals in The Leapfrog Group’s Fall 2024 Hospital Safety Grade Reporting Cycle The Leapfrog Group announced its Fall 2024 Hospital Safety Grades and all four Lee Health hospitals have earned top marks, with Cape Coral Hospital, HealthPark Medical Center and Lee Memorial Hospital being designated as “Straight A” hospitals for earning an “A” in at least five consecutive Hospital Safety Grade reporting cycles. HealthPark Medical Center: Awarded an ‘A’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2024 Gulf Coast Medical Center: Awarded an ‘B’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2024 Cape Coral Hospital: Awarded an ‘A’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2024 Lee Memorial Hospital: Awarded an ‘A’ grade for patient safety for spring and fall 2024 Lee Health is the First Health System in the U.S. to Earn the American Society of Health System Pharmacists Certified Center of Excellence™ Designation in Medication Use Safety and Pharmacy Practice Lee Health is thrilled to announce that it has became the first multi-site health system in the United States to earn the prestigious American Society of Health System Pharmacists Certified Center of Excellence™ designation in Medication Use Safety and Pharmacy Practice. Lee Health Receives Pinnacle of EHR Experience Award Lee Health has been honored with the inaugural Pinnacle of EHR Experience Award from the KLAS Arch Collaborative, recognizing our health system's efforts to enhance the electronic health record (EHR) experience for physicians. The award places Lee Health among an elite group of only 10 organizations nationwide, including Kaiser Permanente and Johns Hopkins, to receive this honor. Lee Memorial Hospital’s Emergency Department Earns the Prestigious Lantern Award for the First Time The emergency department at Lee Memorial Hospital has been recognized for continually providing high-quality care in a safe environment. This is the first time the Emergency Nurses Association (ENA) has awarded the hospital with the Lantern Award, which recognizes emergency departments that go above and beyond in leadership, practice, education, advocacy, and research. Newsweek and Statista Name Lee Health’s HealthPark Care Center Skilled Nursing Facility as One of America’s Best Nursing Homes 2025 Lee Health is pleased to announce that the HealthPark Care Center Skilled Nursing Facility has earned a national recognition and will be featured on the list of America’s Best Nursing Homes 2025 from Newsweek and Statista. Lee Health’s HealthPark Care Center ranked 16th of the approximately 700 nursing homes in Florida. Lee Health Named on Forbes List of America’s Best-in-State Employers for 2024 for the Second Consecutive Year Lee Health is proud to be named on the Forbes list of America’s Best-in-State Employers for the second year in a row. This prestigious award is presented by Forbes and Statista Inc., the leading statistics portal and industry ranking provider, and it is a testament to Lee Health’s commitment to fostering a positive and robust workplace for its employees. Lee Health is Proud to Rank Among the Top 15% of Hospitals in the United States For the Second Consecutive Year, HealthPark Medical Center and Lee Memorial Hospital Earn Five Stars in CMS Quality Star Ratings and Gulf Coast Medical Center and Cape Coral Hospital Earn Four Stars Patient safety and the highest quality of care are Lee Health’s top priorities, and the health system is pleased to announce that all four of its acute care hospitals are four and five star recipients by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). This is the second consecutive year that HealthPark Medical Center and Lee Memorial Hospital have been awarded the highest five-star accolade, putting Lee Health hospitals in the top 15% of hospitals in the country for the second year in a row. Gulf Coast Medical Center and Cape Coral Hospital both maintained their four stars. Children’s hospitals are not included in this ranking system. U.S. News Recognizes Lee Health Hospitals as Best Hospitals 2024-2025 All Lee Health hospitals received honors as Best Hospitals by U.S. News & World Report for the high-quality care they provide to the Southwest Florida community. For its 2024-2025 list, all Lee Health hospitals have been recognized as Best Hospitals with Golisano Children’s Hospital, HealthPark Medical Center and Lee Memorial Hospital ranking 13th in Florida and Gulf Coast Medical Center tying with a hospital in Gainesville for the 27th position. In this year’s rankings, Cape Coral Hospital earned a High-Performing rating in Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) procedures and conditions. Lee Health Named Fourth Top Hospital System in the U.S. As One of the Most Socially Responsible by the Lown Institute Lee Health is proud to be ranked fourth out of 311 health systems in the United States as one of the most socially responsible by the Lown Institute. All Lee Health acute care hospitals also received “A” grades in various metrics. This is the health system’s second year in a row ranking in the top five in the country for its commitment to social responsibility and health equity. Lee Memorial Hospital, which includes HealthPark Medical Center under the same license, ranked number one in Florida for social responsibility and was also in the top-5 in Florida for value of care and avoiding overuse. The Lown Institute awarded Lee Memorial Hospital, HealthPark Medical Center, Cape Coral Hospital and Gulf Coast Medical Center “A” Grades in social responsibility, patient outcomes, clinical outcomes, patient safety, inclusivity, and cost efficiency. Lee Health Is the First Healthcare System in Florida to Be Recognized with the Governor’s Sterling Award Lee Health is honored to be the first healthcare system in Florida to be recognized with the Governor’s Sterling Award, granted by the Sterling Council. The Sterling Council is a public/private partnership supported by the Officer of the Governor that manages the Sterling/Baldrige National Criteria for national standards and best practices for performance excellence in the state of Florida. Lee Health’s HealthPark Medical Center Named Among the Top 50 Hospitals for Heart Care Lee Health’s HealthPark Medical Center has again been named a top performing hospital in the 2024 PINC AI™ 50 Top Cardiovascular Hospitals™ study, joining some of the most elite hospitals in the country that provide top-tier heart care. This marks the 11th year that HealthPark Medical Center has won the award. 2023 Awards & Recognition All Four Lee Health Hospitals Earned ‘Straight As’ for the Second Straight Reporting Period The Leapfrog Group released its Spring 2023 Hospital Safety Grades and all four Lee Health hospitals have earned top marks, continuing their ‘straight A’ streak from last Fall’s grading report. HealthPark Medical Center, Cape Coral Hospital, Gulf Coast Medical Center and Lee Memorial Hospital all received the highest honor of an ‘A’ grade. This marks the 10th straight reporting period that all Lee Health Hospitals have received a grade of ‘B’ or higher. HealthPark Medical Center earned an ‘A’ grade for the ninth straight reporting period, and Gulf Coast Medical Center earned an ‘A’ for the third straight reporting period. Lee Memorial Hospital and Cape Coral Hospital retained their ‘A’ grades after bringing them up from a ‘B’ rating. All Lee Health Acute Care Hospitals Named Among the Best 100 Hospitals in the Nation All Lee Health Acute Care Hospitals Named Among the Best 100 Hospitals in the Nation For the Second Year in a Row All 3 Lee Health Skilled Nursing Facilities Named Best Nursing Homes in the U.S. by U.S. News & World Report U.S. News & World Report named the Lee Memorial Hospital Skilled Nursing Unit, HealthPark Care Center and Gulf Coast Medical Center Skilled Nursing Unit as some of the Best Nursing Homes in the country for the second year in a row. Lee Memorial Hospital Skilled Nursing Unit and Gulf Coast Medical Center Skilled Nursing Unit earned a High Performing rating for short-term rehabilitation, which evaluates a nursing home's quality of care for patients recovering from a hospital stay, such as after a stroke, heart attack, infection or accidental injury. HealthPark Care Center earned a High Performing rating for both short and long-term care, which evaluates a home's ability to care for residents who need daily assistance with medical needs, such as administering medications, and non-medical needs, such as dressing, eating and using the bathroom. Lee Memorial Hospital and Gulf Coast Medical Center’s Skilled Nursing Units were not applicable for the long-term accolade. HealthPark Care & Rehabilitation Center Earns 2023 Gold Seal Award from the Florida Governor’s Office Lee Health’s HealthPark Care & Rehabilitation Center has earned the prestigious 2023 Gold Seal Award from the Florida Governor’s Office. It is one of fewer than 15 in the state of Florida, which has nearly 700 skilled nursing facilities, to receive the distinction. The program awards and recognizes nursing home facilities that promote the stability of the industry, facilitates the physical, social, and emotional well-being of nursing home facility residents, and demonstrates excellence in long-term care over a sustained period. HealthPark Medical Center has been named a 2023 PINC AI 50 Top Cardiovascular Hospital winner by Premier. This marks the tenth year the hospital has won the award. Formerly known as the IBM Watson award, the PINC AI 50 top-performing cardiovascular hospitals represent the highest standard of heart care in the United States. Premier Inc. acquired the distinction from Merative (formally IBM Watson) and the program will be integrated within PINC AI™, Premier’s technology and services brand. HealthPark Medical Center is one of only four hospitals in Florida, and the only hospital in Southwest Florida, to earn the designation. Lee Health Earns Top Marks for Healthcare Technology Implementation Lee Health is among one of the best healthcare systems in the country when it comes to implementing the latest in patient care technology, according to a recently published national recognition. This year marks the 10th consecutive year the health system has achieved this award status. The College of Healthcare Information Management Executives (CHIME) announced that Lee Health has earned the 2023 CHIME Digital Health Most Wired recognition as a certified acute level 8 and ambulatory level 8 facility. This year, there were more than 55,000 facilities represented in the survey. The CHIME Digital Health Most Wired program conducts an annual survey to assess how effectively healthcare organizations apply core and advanced technologies to their clinical and business programs to help improve healthcare in their communities. The purpose of the Most Wired program is to elevate the healthcare of communities around the world through the optimal use of information technology. The annual survey is designed to identify and recognize healthcare organizations that exemplify best practices through their adoption, implementation and use of technology. Lee Health received an “A” Grade on the Lown Institute Hospitals Index for Social Responsibility and all Lee Health hospital locations ranked in the top-5 in Florida. Lee Health as a system also placed in the top-10 in the U.S. for pay equity and patient safety. The Lown Institute also awarded Lee Memorial Hospital, HealthPark Medical Center, Cape Coral Hospital and Gulf Coast Medical Center “A” Grades in patient outcomes, clinical outcomes, patient safety and cost efficiency. Lee Health’s Gulf Coast Medical Center Skilled Nursing Unit Earns National Silver Quality Award The Gulf Coast Medical Center Skilled Nursing Unit (SNU) has earned the 2023 Silver Achievement in Quality Award from the American Health Care Association and National Center for Assisted Living (AHCA/NCAL). The program recognizes organizations that meet progressively rigorous standards of performance to further improve the lives of residents and staff in long-term care. Straight “A” Streak Continues for all Lee Health Acute Care Hospitals The Leapfrog Group released its Fall 2023 Hospital Safety Grades, awarding HealthPark Medical Center, Cape Coral Hospital, Gulf Coast Medical Center and Lee Memorial Hospital an “A” grade, which is the highest honor that can be received. This marks the 12th straight reporting period that all Lee Health Hospitals have received a grade of a “B” or higher. HealthPark Medical Center earned an “A” grade for the 10th straight reporting period, and Gulf Coast Medical Center earned an “A” for the fourth straight reporting period and sixth since 2013. Lee Memorial Hospital and Cape Coral Hospital maintained their “A” grade for the third reporting period in a row. Lee Health’s Cape Coral Hospital Named a Top 100 Hospital by Fortune/PINC AI™ Lee Health’s Cape Coral Hospital has been named among the nation’s Top 100 Hospitals by Fortune/PINC AI™, the technology and services brand of Premier, Inc. This is the second consecutive year that Cape Coral Hospital has received this distinction and the second year as an Everest Winner for achieving a top rate of improvement from 2017 to 2021. Lee Health Awarded on the Forbes America’s Best-in-State Employers 2023 List Lee Health has been awarded on the Forbes list of America’s Best-in-State Employers 2023.
